website_summaries.verdict: Simple aiming mechanism provides great results. Works especially well for long-range targets.
pros: Coating on lens glass resists glares for clearer viewing
Zeroes in on target quickly while also holding the target steady
cons: May not fit all bolt-action rifles properly because of short tube length

customer_reviews.text: This is my third Buckmasters II scope ... I replaced a much more expensive, ultra-long range scope that was mounted on my Mossberg MVP Predator 5.56mm bolt rifle with this scope, which is more appropriate for the caliber. Being a Nikon derivative scope the glass is excellent and low light collection is superb. The scope zero'd quickly and it didn't take long to set up the dead-hold BDC dots. Although Nikon Spot-On isn't intended for the Bushmaster scopes I'm able to get pretty darned close with the dope I put into the system for the rifle and custom loads I shoot... Nikon & Bushmasters have teamed up to produce a useful and affordable series of scopes. Good job, guys!!
customer_reviews.author: jColes

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 total on 3 of my AR Platform Rifles. Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. I put this scope on my M&P 15 in .300 Whisper & .300 Blackout along with the Nikon M-223 1 piece mount. I took to the range and everything sighted in and held zero. I Highly Recommend This Product. I promise you won't beat the Valu and reliability especially using this on my AR platform rifle its hands down a WINNER
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He is very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for sons 30.06. He wanted one with a smaller rear as the bolt almost hit the one in the store. First day out he went thru over 100 rounds and had no issues. He is very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stc2581

customer_reviews.title: Geat scope!
customer_reviews.text: I put it on my .308 AR 10 and This scope is awesome! Holds a zero so far!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest scope for this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Put this one my ar 15/300 blk. Works great. The scope is surprisingly light in weight. Very clear and crisp sight picture. Really happy with this product because it was such a good bargain. I can't believe how clear the scope was for the price. You just can't go wrong with a Nikon. I've had it on my rifle for about 2 months now. After a couple shooting trips, still no issues. Scope holds zero.
customer_reviews.author: Louie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great scope with the BDC reticle
customer_reviews.text: Great scope for the price. Sharp image and easy zoom operation. The BDC reticle (bullet drop compensator) is very helpful/accurate when shooting out to 400 to 600 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Moss

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have a few other Nikon scopes and have never had any issues with them. This is no exception, put this on my 12 gauge right before deer season started and it is very accurate. It would be hard to find something better at this price point, just my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 20 shots
customer_reviews.text: My crosshair came loose and began internally rotating after 20 rounds of 308 through a mossberg MVP. The scope was perfectly leveled and torqued to the manufacturer's recommended 15 inch lbs. Very very disappointed, especially since I had an o-ring break loose on my p223, causing condensation to come into the front lens. These scopes were once good, but have gone downhill. Avoid at all costs.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the scope on my Marlin 45-70
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Nikon Buckmaster for my Marlin 45-70 1895GBL and is an amazing fit for it! The 3-9x scope works extremely well for the low price of the scope. I zeroed the rifle in less than 5 shots at 100 and 150 yards and keeps it's zero indefinitely. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: great starter scope
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of nikon cameras and it seems they don't fall back on scopes either! this scope has great eye relief, a clear image and some dots that show drop though I don't use those at all. I have it mounted on a 308 AR-10 and it handles the recoil like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Entry Level Hunting Scope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go on my brother-in-law's deer rifle. Nice scope for the price. The reticle is useful for various calibers and the resettable turrets are very nice to have in a scope of this price point. The scope I ordered was a 3-9x40, but the one I received was the 4-12x40...Bonus!!!
customer_reviews.author: I.H.

customer_reviews.title: Nikon scope lover
customer_reviews.text: Nikon hands down is my father and mine go to scope. Nothing in this price range comes close to these scopes. I have the 4x12 on my CVA Optima LR and now I have the 3x9 on my Savage 220 slug gun. It's gotta mean something that I took off the 3x9 Bushnell slug gun scope off the 220. That scope was dialed and I mean dialed. The clearity and the low light image is so much better than the Bushnell. These scope allow you to get every minute of time in the woods!
customer_reviews.author: Chafer92

customer_reviews.title: Good scope. Just be aware that there's only 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Good scope. Just be aware that there's only 5 inches of 1" tube for mounting the rings. Many bolt-action rifles require mounts wider than this to clear the bolt opening.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Higher quality than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this scope. Im impressed with the quality nikon put in to this scope at a very low price. I mounted it on a Henry 22 mag. The spot on app is a must have when you own a nikon scope and want to reach out a little further than your zero target range. The turrets are dead accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon II Buck Master 3-9x40 5-stars
customer_reviews.text: Mounted to Mossberg model 930 12 gauge in fall of 2018. It took 3 rounds to dail it in. Since then I have dropped both deer that I shot at. Both at +/- 60 yards. As of now it is still dead on even though I have not been gentle with it. Still crystal clear despite being rained on & carried in the field in everything from high humidity to below freezing. I think this is well worth the money. And the bdc reticle would make quite versatile on other guns and at even longer ranges.
customer_reviews.author: BecauseHeLives

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Optics
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea if this was a quality scope or not judging from low cost, far less than most scopes, but it was a Nikon. Incredibly surprised with the optics, clarity and eye relief, perfect for the rifle I put it on, four shot sight in. Longevity? we will see, but it is high quality, expect it to last. Very pleased. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ZOOMING AHEAD OF THE COMPETITION!
customer_reviews.text: GOT YOUR SIGHTS SET ON AN AWESOME SCOPE?? THIS IS IT! SO POWERFUL AND CLEAR I CAN SEE THE FUTURE. IT'S EVEN WATERPROOF! I WAS SCOPING THIS NIKON OUT FOR A COUPLE DAYS, AND IT IS RIGHT ON THE MONEY FROM A QUALITY AND PRICE COMBO! GIVES YOU A LOT OF BANG FOR YOUR BUCK! NO BATTERIES REQUIRED. (NOT DESIGNED FOR USE ON POOL CUES OR CIRCULAR SAWS.)
customer_reviews.author: Deanne Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Good price for good quality
customer_reviews.text: For the money one of the best Scopes on the market. Glass is nice , clarity to edge is good . To get better glass and scope you have to jump into the 400$ range.
customer_reviews.author: gun dog LV

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Had the scope just over a year, however fired less than 250 rounds through the AR-10 on which it is mounted. Went to range today and noticed a gradual downfall in accuracy. Eventualy I wasnt even on paper anymore. Scope rings were secure. Looked at the front lens of scope and the rubber ring was hanging halfway out and the glass was rattling around. Never dropped, carefully kept, never bumped. I refuse to accept that a piece of equipment designed to be mounted on a rifle, cannot withstand less than 250 rds over the span of one year... Havent tried customer service yet, will update accordingly. At this point, unlikely to recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Oneil

customer_reviews.title: Good so far, from a reputable company
customer_reviews.text: High-quality optics from a company that knows about lenses. This is a great deal on a solid piece of equipment. I have not owned this scope long enough to speak to its durability, but early results are good, and I expect that Nikon put the necessary effort into producing a reliable product, considering the intended use for this product (hunting, which is not generally gentle on eqipment) and their reputation for quality products.
customer_reviews.author: AKMonkeyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't hold a zero
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 450 bushmaster based on a couple reviews. It zeroed in 5 shots, but after 20 shots it was all over. everything appeared to be tight. So I returned and got money back and bought different Nikon. Could have just been the scope I received as others seem to like it. Just didnt work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scope i have 3 of these on other rifles and at this price you will be hard pressed to find anything that comes anywhere close. I use it for deer and coyote hunting in kentucky and it has never fogged up or lost zero over the years ive been using the buckmaster line of scope.
customer_reviews.author: Jarron owens

customer_reviews.title: Clear and bright
customer_reviews.text: I really like these scopes! No they aren’t a Burris or anything fancy but for $125 they are bright, clear and hold zero. Mine is on a .17hmr so no recoil but I would put one on any of my rifles and not worry about it losing zero. I have 2 pro staff 5’s and Nikon has some really good glass. Thinking about buying my son one for his 6.5 for now
customer_reviews.author: Blake G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent optics at low low prices
customer_reviews.text: Excellent optics for the value. Mounted on my PTR91. 100 yards tight groupings. No loss of accuracy after 100rds of hard hitting .308 (match grade). The target looked waay better than my barska sighting scope - better clarity more light its just good optics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality at an Affordable Price!
customer_reviews.text: Bright, clear optics. Very well built. Sharp focus at 25 yards and beyond. Parallax is Pre-set at 100 yds for average hunting situations. Awesome windage and elevation turrets. You can feel each click. Nikon Buckmaster and ProStaff scopes are a great value! Thanks for a great price, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value
customer_reviews.text: Used on my AR and it worked great. The reticle is a bit off when shooting 55 grain M193, but once I learned the hold over I was hitting a 4" gong at 300 yards pretty reliably. Very impressed so far with the low price and quality of glass. It appears that the reticle is made for 62 grain ammo, so I'll test that next time and hopefully its spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I am used to much more expensive scopes. Have Leupold scopes on most of my hunting rifles. But I have to admit, the Nikon Buckmaster is a great value. Optics are excellent. Hard to beat for the money.
customer_reviews.author: GONEMAD

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid scope for beginners. My 10year old used it this year on his 308 and liked it on the range. He didn’t get a deer with it, only because I didn’t let him take a doe early in the season. I like the feature below the crosshairs showing the bullet fall over a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly rugged and clear
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked as to how clear the glass was. After sighting it in I gave the scope a wacks with the palm of my hand and it held zero at 50 yards. Since its been on my rifle, ive taken out 3 groundhogs with ease. All headshots.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Caruso

customer_reviews.title: ... to the range all I can say it looks great on my Savage 308 and the lens it's crystal ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to go to the range all I can say it looks great on my Savage 308 and the lens it's crystal clear. Update 12/18/18 Had a chance to go to the range It holds zero easily at 100 yards I would recommend it. I was able to take it to the range, got it zero out I can easily take steel head shots at 100 yards. I would totally recommend it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: PonceGlock23

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this scope, it is absalutely fantastic. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Great scope.
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with nikon. I have nikon scopes on all my AR's and rifles. Five shots and I was zeroed. Recommended to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Markmark

customer_reviews.title: exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Out side of a small cosmetic "ding" caused from the item being shipped in a large box and the shipping company being careless everything is in working order. This is not my first nikon scope, and will not be my last, great clarity and are rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Mixted

customer_reviews.title: This such an excellent buy. It fit the gunj and works great
customer_reviews.text: This such an excellent buy. It fit the gunj and works great. just be sure to order the mounts for the exact gun. These you will need to order elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Nice Scope
customer_reviews.text: I got the scope on sale. I feel that it is a very nice scope for the money spent. I don't know about the BDC since most of the shots I take are 100 yds or less. It is clear and works pretty well in low light conditions
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: it is ok
customer_reviews.text: It is clear and overall good quality. However when I am shooting at 100 yard magnification is not enough for me. I needed to purchase scope with higher magnification. For 50 yards it is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Sergiy

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Nikon, so it’s a quality scope
customer_reviews.text: For me Nikon is the best scope my money can buy. The clarity is top notch and you don’t get that fish bowl effect on the outer edges that you do with cheap scopes.
customer_reviews.author: Jondogg187

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Took it to the range to sight it in, 4 rounds through it and broke
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent AR scope for the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality for a budget scope, is bright and has good eye relief. It was easy to use and held zero fine. I mounted it using the Nikon P-Series Riflescope Picatinny Mount for 1 Inch Tube, also sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: zanypoet

customer_reviews.title: Reticle is fuzzy, unusable!
customer_reviews.text: Reticle is fuzzy as can be, and no matter what I did it will not clear up! Useless as an actual rifle scope!
customer_reviews.author: joshua nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Nikon rifle scopes Walmart $150 I got two of them Amazon $140 same scope good deal
customer_reviews.text: Nikon rifle scope nice cheap have two of them two different rifles will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Marlin Walker

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Advertised and Reviewed
customer_reviews.text: For my 45-70 Marlin build. Go to Nikon's website and plug in your ammunition. The app. will provide drop rates for this optic and your preferred ammunition. Great buy as well...
customer_reviews.author: Blade-6

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat the quality you receive for the price. Have it on my Henry 45-70. Had to remove the rear sight to accommodate, but used the Talley Henry 1" Medium Scope Mounts for H010 and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great scope
customer_reviews.text: Using the scope on my AR-15. it was easy to get it in site and I haven't had any problems while hunting hogs with it. Good focus and clarity. Great product highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth92

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice for the price, no side focus which I think is a must have scope feature worth paying extra for.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: First year kill
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scope for my girlfriends(her first year hunting) brand new Savage axis 243 compact. Mounted and boresighted very well. Sight in only took 9 rounds to be dead on at 100 yards. Played around with a few different rounds and grains. Scope held true to 1/2 MOA at 100 yard. On opening day of the gun season she took a big 4x4 mulie at 150 yards. DRT. Great scope. All of my rifles have Nikon BDC scopes and have never been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CALVIN CAMPBELL

customer_reviews.title: Great price for an entry level
customer_reviews.text: I have this on a AR15 in .300 blackout and has not gone out of zero. Really good sight for a budget Varmit shooter.
customer_reviews.author: Chavs

customer_reviews.title: A scope is ok.
customer_reviews.text: when I got it .it is supposed to be a brand new item that is what I paid for but looks like open item or some .broken box and wasn't new. I don't buy this seller not anymore. a scope is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Boney maloney

customer_reviews.title: I love my Nikon scopes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Nikon BDC scope. Great clarity, and the Nikon Spot-on program is awesome. It saves a lot of time and money at the range.
customer_reviews.author: James M Cornett

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for husband for deer season, tired of the only one bringing the meat home... Husband shot 3 deer this season so obviously please with this scope!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Mounted on CVA Optima2
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the scope that originally came with the muzzlewloader...it wouldn't stay sighted-in. Mounted this scope just before hunting season and it worked grear. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: LowPressure

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace a nikon 3x9x40 buckmasters on my 243 because i wanted the bdc..... I have an 8" steel target at 194yrds in my backyard, first shot hit dead center, took another jus to be sure and hit the same spot, 3 days later shot a coyote at 247yrds and a skunk at about 50yrds...I don't think you'll find a better scope under $250
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scope without breaking the bank
customer_reviews.text: Great precision for the price. Has a very durable feel as well. First or second time shooting with this scope after zeroing and I’ve already instilled full confidence in it, easily places groups of rounds touching each other at 200 yards (my zero point). The Nikon SpotOn app is also extremely helpful for calculating bdc’s
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Rifle scope
customer_reviews.text: One of the best inexpensive scopes I ever bought. Holds zero, it's clear and you have a ballistic app that works nicely. Definitely recommend this scope. This also my second one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I own many Nikon scopes. Best glass for the money BY FAR
customer_reviews.author: Michael Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on an AR platform (.556). Easy to zero, and 3" groups at 100 yds. Not too bad for 60 year old eyes ;)
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Bright, clear, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what else I can say. It's exactly as advertised and seems to be holding up very well, though it's only on a .22 at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Hey Trojan

customer_reviews.title: No help here.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived superfast. Returned almost as quick. Husband wanted a different high power scoped out. :( So my surprise didn't go as planned. Seemed like a good one for what I wanted to spend.
customer_reviews.author: mommax2klaas

customer_reviews.title: I only use Nikon on all my rifles, never ...
customer_reviews.text: I only use Nikon on all my rifles, never have had any problems with them, from the least expensive one to the higher priced ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best scope I have used so far
customer_reviews.text: The best scope I have used so far, the clearest picture out of the 5 scopes I have used and the price was fair. Will be purchasing another.
customer_reviews.author: joe zito

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and clear
customer_reviews.text: Wow nailing targets with this scope I never Bother writing reviews but this scope deserves one
customer_reviews.author: Everythingorange

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Used this on an AR-15 with a NIKON 1in M-223 Scope Mount. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for my muzzleloader
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on my CVA Optima Muzzleloader and have had great results. The glass is clear and the image is sharp. It definitely lets in enough light even as the sun was going down.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: I own 3 now
customer_reviews.text: Good for any level shooter. Very clear very well made overall.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing rifle scope
customer_reviews.text: Amazing scope. Didn’t take long to sight in on my Remington 770 30.06. Huge upgrade over the scope the rifle came with. Really good investment for hunting without breaking the bank. I don’t have to worry about missing anymore shots during hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Brayman

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Put on my Savage 350 legend. Holds a very accurate group
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Best scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Well made, clear, accurate. Only negative at all is that the focus ring is very very tight initially. Need pliers to turn the first time
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Clear and great value
customer_reviews.text: Great clear beginner scope will work with just about anything. Much better then my utg
customer_reviews.author: shawnM

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Nice clear optics in this scope. Build quality is typical Nikon solid. Looking forward to having years of shooting with this scope.
customer_reviews.author: Quidam

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the price. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used it for deer season and it did a great job for the price. Love the magnification and as long as it's sighted in it's a very accurate product.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay focused
customer_reviews.text: I can’t seem to keep this focused. I just starting using this scope in December but purchased in October. Says I am outside of the return window. Very frustrating. It’s focused sometime and sometime it is just blurry. I have tried everything.
customer_reviews.author: brad green

customer_reviews.title: Very clear optics anxious to get this product on the range It has a built-in ballistic calculator
customer_reviews.text: Very clear optics anxious to get this product on the range
customer_reviews.author: fred van krevelen

customer_reviews.title: Scope is very clear.
customer_reviews.text: The scope arrived on time in good condition. I mounted it on the Rifle with no problems. The scope is very clear and it was easy to zero in.
customer_reviews.author: EJC

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck in quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an addition to my rifle, it’s perfect, great value, seems to be great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you want to return it.
customer_reviews.text: The scope is perfect, but I was gifted one like it, so I wanted to make a return the day I received it. The seller wanted a 20% restocking fee, so I kept the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Clear optics, mounted perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Mounted on my t/c 270 with no hassle. Had the rifle sighted within 10 mins. Very happy with this scope and excited for hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Huys

customer_reviews.title: works perfect. brand new out of the box got to ...
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a savage Axis 7mm-08 rifle (left handed). It is a youth rifle, works perfect. brand new out of the box got to 3" groups at 100 yards. Love the BDC feature.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Got me a deer
customer_reviews.text: Great scope! I was able to shoot a deer at 300 yards last year with my 30 ‘06- stays true once dialed in and haven’t had to mess with the sites since
customer_reviews.author: J. Cutlin

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift to myself. It is easy with good features.
customer_reviews.author: Joel A Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear!
customer_reviews.text: Very good scope for the price. I installed it on Marlin 44 Mag it is perfect :)
customer_reviews.author: Valdis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect scope for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The set screw on the focus adjustment does not have to be loosened before changing the magnification. I made a dumb mistake loosening it. Once mounted and sighted, it was just what I needed. In low light the BDC is still very prominent without batteries. Very nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon says it all
customer_reviews.text: I am 34 and have been around firearms my whole life and let me tell you this scope is nice compared to any high end optic I've owned or used throughout the years I am very pleased ! Clarity is crystal, holds zero, I will definitely buy another in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: exactly what i expect
customer_reviews.text: Nikon and it didn't disappoint once zeroed extremely accurate worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: Ok scope on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Might have just been me but I had the bracket holding the scope come loose a few times. Kept a decent group at 100 yards when it all stayed tightened down.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Mattie

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Scope works great with my ruger pc carbine. Have it sighted in for 50 y but its really a 100 plus scope. Awesome .No complaints. Great bang for your buck scope. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Leave your coins in your pocket!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a bundled Nikon scope on a Salvage .308 with this scope. I like the fact you don't need a coin or bullet to adjust the elevation and windage and the fact you can reset the turrets.
customer_reviews.author: Colem022

customer_reviews.title: Nikon is the best combination of value and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped on time. Packed to protect the scope well. Nikon is quality and all though the savings was minor I am happy too be able to save and receive a scope quality .
customer_reviews.author: DRG

customer_reviews.title: Great optics and very durable in the field.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and service. Totally satisfied with purchase. Long time hunter and sportsman. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Crystal Clear Optics never had a problem with any Nikon scope this is a good all-purpose scope
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Beat a Nikon
customer_reviews.text: Nikon has some of the brightest optics on the market. I use nothing but Nikon on all my long guns. They are tough, durable and deadly accurate.
customer_reviews.author: William Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good scope
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted a scope for his rifle and this is the one he picked out. It works as it's supposed to and he's happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scope that won't break the bank.
customer_reviews.text: Great scope but had to find different brackets to fit my Savage Axis 30-06. It was a hair shorter than my original mounts could hold but still a great scope
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: this scope is well made and works great mounted on my Crosman Titan Np air rifle
customer_reviews.text: this scope is well made and works great mounted on my Crosman Titan Np air rifle. it has a nice clear view and i love the BDC.I wud recommend this to a friend or anyone looking for good optics
customer_reviews.author: lendon

customer_reviews.title: Buckmaster II
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 for me and 1 for a friend. I love this scope and so did he. We both agree the scope is as clear as my Leopold I have on another rifle.
customer_reviews.author: T. MCNEELY

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Bought it to put on my AR-15. Works great! Super easy to zero. Love the reticle. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Spot on! Easy to dial in. Maintains Zero. Great basic scope!
customer_reviews.author: Infidel65

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Good product and construction. Very happy with the quality and fit.
customer_reviews.author: di

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I only have 2 issues. 1. It dogged on me in Missouri this year in the cold air. 2. It did not cover glare very well at sundown. I love the clarity and accuracy of the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin chandler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scope for the money Mounted it with talley wings and bases on wy Weather Vanguard II 30-06
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scope for the money Mounted it with talley wings and bases on wy Weather Vanguard II 30-06
customer_reviews.author: rapid1

product_meta.title: Nikon Buckmasters II 3-9x40 BDC
product_meta.description: NIKON BUCKMASTERS II 3-9X40MM BDC 1IN WATERPROOF MATTE BLACK RIFLESCOPE One of the most trusted riflescopes among deer hunters has now been reinvigorated with the all-new BUCKMASTERS II riflescope series. The BUCKMASTERS II series offers the brightness and clarity of Nikon's Fully Multicoated lenses, as well as the generous eye relief, 100-yards parallax setting and Nikon's popular BDC reticle. If you're passionate about hunting deer, the BUCKMASTERS II is the right choice for your next hunt. SPECIFICATIONS Magnification: 3-9xObjective Diameter, mm: 40Field of View (FOV) @ 100yds, ft.: 4. 4-13. 3 Tube Diameter, in: 1"Adjustment Graduation, in: 1/4 Eye Relief, in: 3. 6" Exit Pupil, mm: 4. 4-13. 3Max Internal Adjustment: 80 MO Parallax Setting, yds.: 100Reticle: BDC Weight, oz.: 13. 1 Length, in: 12. 3"
